text:
Mustafa Al-Kadhimi (; born Mustafa Abdul-Latif Mishatat), alternatively spelt Mustafa Al-Kadhimiy, is an Iraqi politician. He became the Prime Minister of Iraq on 6 May 2020. Kadhimi is also the 43rd Prime Minister since the country's independence in 1932 and the fourth overall under the 2005 constitution.
He is also a former director of the Iraqi National Intelligence Service, originally appointed in June 2016.
